pullRequest.body:
Second PR in a sequence to implement the notion of topological entropy for maps using Bowen-Dinaburg's formalism. This file defines a notion of topological entropy for transformations of a uniform space, using covers.

- [x] Dynamical uniformities
- [x] Topological entropy via covers
- [ ] Topological entropy via nets
- [ ] Behaviour under morphisms
- [ ] Behaviour for subsets and unions
- [ ] Behaviour under products
- [ ] Full shift

Things get more serious. The first file was pretty short; this one is the longest.

Paging @pitmonticone @sgouezel

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [4add94b784](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15753/commits/4add94b78477f6dd03b087582deb32b17dc20a35)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Dynamics.TopologicalEntropy.CoverEntropy`|1354|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsDynCoverOf`
`+ IsDynCoverOf.coverEntropyEnt_le_log_card_div`
`+ IsDynCoverOf.iterate_le_pow`
`+ IsDynCoverOf.nonempty`
`+ IsDynCoverOf.nonempty_inter`
`+ IsDynCoverOf.of_entourage_subset`

`+ coverEntropy`
`+ coverEntropyEnt`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_antitone`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_empty`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_finite_of_isCompact_invariant`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_le_coverEntropy`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_le_coverEntropyInfEnt`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_le_log_coverMincard_div`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_nonneg`
`+ coverEntropyEnt_univ`
`+ coverEntropyInf`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_antitone`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_empty`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_le_coverEntropyEnt`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_le_coverEntropyInf`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_nonneg`
`+ coverEntropyInfEnt_univ`
`+ coverEntropyInf_antitone`
`+ coverEntropyInf_empty`
`+ coverEntropyInf_eq_coverEntropy`
`+ coverEntropyInf_eq_iSup_basis`
`+ coverEntropyInf_le_coverEntropy`
`+ coverEntropyInf_nonneg`
`+ coverEntropy_antitone`
`+ coverEntropy_empty`
`+ coverEntropy_eq_iSup_basis`
`+ coverEntropy_nonneg`
`+ coverMincard`
`+ coverMincard_antitone`
`+ coverMincard_empty`
`+ coverMincard_eq_zero_iff`
`+ coverMincard_finite_iff`
`+ coverMincard_finite_of_isCompact_invariant`
`+ coverMincard_finite_of_isCompact_uniformContinuous`
`+ coverMincard_le_card`
`+ coverMincard_le_pow`
`+ coverMincard_monotone_time`
`+ coverMincard_mul_le_pow`
`+ coverMincard_univ`
`+ coverMincard_zero`
`+ exists_isDynCoverOf_of_isCompact_invariant`
`+ exists_isDynCoverOf_of_isCompact_uniformContinuous`
`+ isDynCoverOf_empty`
`+ isDynCoverOf_univ`
`+ isDynCoverOf_zero`
`+ log_coverMincard_iterate_le`

`+ log_coverMincard_nonneg`

`+ one_le_coverMincard_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Just merged master to fix the conflict.

bors r+
Thanks a lot!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10547647491/job/29220603939)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10547647491/job/29220604166)

First pass on the beginning of the file. Looks great to me! Can you already have a look at the rest of the file taking into account the comments I made on the first 200 lines?

Also, can you merge master to fix the conflict?

If your lemma statement does not mention `antitone`, your lemma name shouldn't either. Also, since it deals with `IsDynCoverOf`, it should mention `isDynCoverOf`. Since you have an assumption `IsDynCoverOf`, I would probably call it `IsDynCoverOf.of_le` to make sure it can be used through dot notation. 

Could you review all lemma names in the PR according to these conventions?
BTW, done as well as I could. I've also simplified a few things (avoid using sInf, and removed a small lemma which wasn't used).
Better say `IsDynCoverOf T ∅ U n s` for an arbitrary `s`. This will be a better simp lemma, as it will apply more often.
Done.

```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun y y_F ↦ ?_, Finset.card_mono (Finset.filter_subset _ s)⟩ 
```
It's more idiomatic to use the anonymous constructor than an explicit `And.intro`, and it lets you introduce the variables right away.
Done. Thanks.

```suggestion
  exact ⟨z, ⟨z_s, nonempty_of_mem ⟨y_Bz, y_F⟩⟩, y_Bz⟩
```
Again, anonymous constructor is often better than `use`, because it lets you fill in other fields.
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
/-- This lemma is the first step in a submultiplicative-like property of `coverMincard`, with
```
Also, it's very nice to explain what the lemma is useful for (definitely keep that!), but adding a sentence describing the content of the lemma is also very helpful.
Done. Thanks for your comments!

```suggestion
  rcases F.eq_empty_or_nonempty with rfl | F_nemp
```
no need for parentheses in `rcases`.

Same thing below.
Done. Thanks.

```suggestion
  have (t : Fin n → s) : ∃ y : X, (⋂ k : Fin n, T^[m * k] ⁻¹' ball (t k) (dynEntourage T U m)) ⊆
      ball y (dynEntourage T (U ○ U) (m * n)) := by
```
`have` lets you write parameters on the left of the colon, to improve readability (and you don't need to `intro` it in the proof).
Done. Thanks.

```suggestion
      exact ⟨x, empty_subset _⟩
```
Done. Thanks.

```suggestion
  refine ⟨sn.toFinset, ?_, ?_⟩
```
You resolved the conversation, but I don't see the change. Did you forget to push?
Sorry for this, pushed now.

```suggestion
  have := fintypeRange dyncover
```
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
      exact ⟨⟨z, z_s⟩, hz⟩
```
Done, thanks.

If the lemma involves `IsCompact` and `UniformContinuous`, the lemma name should probably be `exists_isDynCoverOf_of_isCompact_uniformContinuous` (and maybe swap the order of the assumptions to match the name of the lemma).
Done. Thanks.
When a proof is more than 15 lines, it is helpful to include comments to explain what is going on, either as a sketch at the beginning of the proof, or comments as the proof goes.
Done, I've added documentation to: `IsDynCoverOf.iterate_le_pow`, `nonempty_inter_of_coverMincard`, `log_coverMincard_le_add`.

```suggestion
/-! ### Minimal cardinality of dynamical covers -/
```
(In English, cardinal is for cardinal numbers, cardinality is for number of elements in a set). Same thing below.
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
lemma coverMincard_monotone (T : X → X) (F : Set X) (U : Set (X × X)) :
```
Done, thanks.

Reverting this one.

There is a statement in another file (but under the same namespace) which goes

`Monotone (fun F : Set X ↦ coverMincard T F U n)`

I know that `time` is not a good descriptor, but I need a way to differentiate these two statements.

```suggestion
lemma coverMincard_antitone (T : X → X) (F : Set X) (n : ℕ) :
```
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
    0 < coverMincard T F U n ↔ F.Nonempty := by
```
(Oherwise, use `one_le_coverMincard_iff` as the lemma name)

Done.

I changed the name of the lemma ; the lower bound `1` is too useful when applying logarithms.
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
lemma coverMincard_le_pow {T : X → X} {F : Set X} (F_inv : MapsTo T F F) {U : Set (X × X)}
```
There is no composition in the lemma (apart from the entourages, but it's already there in the other lemmas and you never mentioned it).
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
  smallest `(n, U)`-refined cover of `F`. Takes values in the space of extended real numbers
```
Done, thanks.
I'm not sure about the name. What is `Uni` supposed to mean?

It stands for "entourage", obviously.

I've changed `Uni` for `Ent`. I'm still open to better ideas, but this object has no standard name that I know of, and this is the best we could come up with.
Maybe put this in the `IsDynCoverOf` namespace? Also, wouldn't it be better to give it for the `SupUni`?
Yes and yes. Done.

I have a problem that, with the way the results are currently phrased, the end user will not know if he should use `coverEntropInf` or `coverEntropySup` as the canonical one (since they coincide in the most relevant cases) and different users might pick different choices. I guess it's worth making one choice more canonical than the other by using the name `coverEntropy` -- and explaining carefully in the docstrings, both of the definition and the file-level docstring, what is going on here.

Good idea.

I've chosen to make the `limsup` definition canonical. I don't think it changes much, but there is a remote reason why it might avoid some rewrites (thanks to `coverEntropyEnt_le_log_card_div`, getting upper bounds on the `liminf`/`limsup` versions is essentially the same ; lower bounds on the entropy are trickier, and easier with a `limsup` than a `liminf`).
You need to mention also the main theorems here, notably the submultiplicativity one at finite times, and the fact that `coverEntropInf = coverEntropySup` when `F` is invariant.
Done. I've also added `IsDynCoverOf.coverEntropyEnt_le_log_card_div`, which is of great practical use.
Wouldn't it be better to deduce this lemma from `coverEntropySupUni_le_log_coverMincard_div` and the trivial inequality? Or remove it altogether, as it's a trivial consequence of the other one?

Good idea. I've just removed the `Inf` versions.

I've also proved directly `coverEntropyEnt_finite_of_isCompact_invariant` and removed the `Inf` version.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Dynamics.TopologicalEntropy): add CoverEntropy
